messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Samurai collectables and sword study show
messages.msgSnippet: More information on this show is available at: http://home.comcast.net/~midwesttokenkai/Sword%20Show.htm I will be there with 3 tables of books and a few other
messages.messageBody:
More information on this show is available at:

http://home.comcast.net/~midwesttokenkai/Sword%20Show.htm

I will be there with 3 tables of books and a few other things for sale
(tsuba, old sword box, laqcuer folding camp chair ...) Please stop by and
introduce yourself!

There will be plenty to see (and buy!), and two fantastic talks, one on
swords by Bob Benson and another on tsuba by Jim Gilbert. There will likely
be a Kendo demonstration, but no other swinging of anything resembling a
sword due to liability concerns.

--
Craig Harris
Books from and about Asia
www.bridgeofdreams.com

> 3400 Euclid Ave. Arlington heights.

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Samurai collectables and sword study show
messages.msgSnippet: Scott et al- By all accounts the Chicago show keeps getting better and better. People of all ages and all levels of interest are welcome. I can t be there in
messages.messageBody:
Scott et al-
By all accounts the Chicago show keeps getting better and better.
People of all ages and all levels of interest are welcome. I can't be
there in May I have to save all my money for the San Francisco show
in August...
-t

http://www.ncjsc.org/NCJSC_events.htm

messages.subject: Samurai collectables and sword study show
messages.msgSnippet: My Japanese instructor showed me an add in the Japanesenewspaper for Chicago that there will a Sword show in chicago on May 5- May 7.  I teach Kenjitsu so I
messages.messageBody:
My Japanese instructor showed me an add in the Japanesenewspaper for
Chicago that there will a Sword show in chicago on May 5- May 7. I
teach Kenjitsu so I must go. It's at the Sheraton Chicago northwest
3400 Euclid Ave. Arlington heights.
